answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Elevated liver enzymes indicate liver damage. This damage can occur in a variety of diseases like viral hepatitis, chronic liver disease like chronic hepatitis and cirrhosis.Please remember that moderate elevations are commonplace and can occur as a result of alcohol abuse, diabetes and obesity.Peptic ulcers are more common in patients with helicobacter pylori in the stomach. Ruptured peptic ulcer is an emergency and should be treated urgently. Ruptured peptic ulcer will not cause elevated liver enzymes.Take care!

question: Another problem to add to my ever growing list:Recent Hepatic Function Panel indicates that both the AST (SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) are way off the charts HIGH. What could that mean?Would a perforated pyloric ulcer cause the problem?
title: Migraine's Girl - New Dilemma
